agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Urban Affairs TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: E2.010 CHAIR: Rep. Angie Button The Committee will meet to hear the following: HB 40 Romero, Jr. Relating to a study on migrant labor housing facilities. HB 50 Romero, Jr. Relating to the regulation of migrant labor housing facilities. HB 266 Bernal Relating to the definition of sanitary, decent, and safe dwelling for housing developments. HB 681 Stephenson Relating to the inclusion of territory of a municipality in a proposed county assistance district. HB 2185 Rodriguez Relating to the eligibility of certain municipalities to establish homestead preservation districts and reinvestment zones. HB 2445 Parker Relating to the addition of territory to a crime control and prevention district. HB 2532 González, Jessica | et al. Relating to the eligibility of certain municipalities to designate homestead preservation districts. HB 2858 Toth | et al. Relating to adoption of a swimming pool and spa code for use in municipalities in this state. HB 3439 Patterson | et al. Relating to the authority of a municipality or county to require a labor peace agreement as a condition of engaging in a commercial transaction with the municipality or county. HB 3513 Martinez Fischer Relating to a right of first refusal applicable to the sale of housing developments that have received certain financial assistance administered by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs. HB 3778 Button Relating to regulation of short-term rental units; authorizing a civil penalty; limiting the amount of a fee. Public testimony may be limited to 3 minutes. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
